title: Multimodal Learning for Cardiac Health Assessment
author: Radiant Group
excerpt: Combining medical images and structured signals to assess cardiac health.
content:
## Context
Cardiac assessment relies on multiple complementary signals, including imaging, numerical indicators, and clinical context.

Unimodal AI systems fail to capture this complexity.

## Problem Statement
Models trained on a single modality miss clinically relevant interactions between signals.

## Design Principles
- Representation-level fusion
- Interpretability-first design

## System Overview
Visual embeddings from echocardiography are fused with structured clinical indicators such as ejection fraction.

## Technical Choices
Fusion occurs at the representation level to preserve modality-specific structure.

## Evaluation
Explainability and confidence calibration are mandatory components of the pipeline.

## Limitations
Temporal alignment between modalities remains challenging.

## Lessons Learned
Multimodality improves robustness and mirrors clinical reasoning.

## Conclusion
Cardiac intelligence is inherently multimodal and must be modeled accordingly.
